newsitem.title: CANADA: Loewen says holders view bid as low-report.
newsitem.headline: Loewen says holders view bid as low-report.

text.p: Loewen Group Inc said some major shareholders told the funeral home company that Service Corp International's US$43 a share bid for Loewen was low, Toronto's Globe and Mail newspaper reported on Friday.
"So far, institutional shareholders thought the offer was very light," Loewen senior vice-president of finance Paul Wagler was quoted as telling reporters in Vancouver.
The Globe said Wagler spoke with reporters before meeting with 60 of Loewen's lenders on Thursday. The meeting was scheduled months before Service launched its unsolicited bid this week.
While Service Corp's proposal was unsolicited, Wagler said it "just reinforces our view of the shareholder value" in Loewen, the newspaper reported.
"I think it's the sincerest form of recognition our company could (receive)," Wagler said.
He said Loewen's board of directors would decide whether to fight the bid at its next meeting, scheduled within the next few days, the newspaper said.
